title: Trump’s Laissez-Faire Stance Gives Netanyahu Free Pass for Gaza Escalation
summary: As Israel mounts a major Gaza offensive, President Trump has neither urged restraint nor endorsed the action, which Israel’s leader has taken as an implicit green light to proceed.

title: Israeli Ground Forces Move Into Gaza City, Sowing Chaos
summary: The long-anticipated military assault is aimed, the Israelis said, at routing the militants of Hamas, but it deepened the humanitarian crisis in the Gaza Strip.

title: Satellite Images Show Israeli Military Buildup Around Gaza City
summary: The images show Israeli armored vehicles in multiple places along the outskirts of the city on Tuesday morning, after Israel said it had begun its armed offensive into the city.

title: Robert Redford, Screen Idol Turned Director and Activist, Dies at 89
summary: He made serious topics like grief and political corruption resonate with the masses, in no small part because of his own star power.

title: Robert Redford, American Style Icon
summary: Reluctant to focus on style or his looks, Mr. Redford nevertheless became the embodiment of an enduring aesthetic.

title: Bob Woodward Remembers Robert Redford
summary: Mr. Woodward said Mr. Redford, who portrayed him in the classic 1976 film “All the President’s Men,” was a “genuine, a noble and principled force for good.”

title: Meryl Streep, Barbra Streisand and Others Mourn Robert Redford
summary: Redford “stood for an America we have to keep fighting for,” his frequent collaborator Jane Fonda said after his death was announced on Tuesday.

title: State Terrorism Charges Against Luigi Mangione Are Dismissed
summary: The judge overseeing the case against Mr. Mangione said the evidence underpinning two of the most serious counts, one of which charged him with first-degree murder, was “legally insufficient.”

title: Howard Lutnick, the Pierre Hotel and Claims of a Secret Plan
summary: Some residents of the Pierre claim that Howard Lutnick, who owns the penthouse, was part of a plot to sell off this symbol of Manhattan glamour and wealth.

title: G.O.P. Again Cedes Power on Tariffs to Avoid Crossing Trump
summary: House Republicans extended a maneuver they engineered earlier in the year that effectively strips Congress of the power to disapprove of President Trump’s tariffs.

title: House Passes D.C. Crime Bills as Trump Crackdown Continues
summary: The legislation is part of a package that House Republicans are pushing to impose more federal control over the District in line with President Trump’s demands.

title: Trump Sues The New York Times For Articles Questioning His Success
summary: The lawsuit, filed by the president in federal court in Florida, claims The Times defamed him and sought to undermine his campaign in the 2024 election.

title: Former C.D.C. Director to Tell Lawmakers She Was ‘Fired for Holding the Line’
summary: Susan Monarez is set to provide her first detailed account of her ouster in testimony before the Senate Health Committee on Wednesday.

title: Cassidy, His Job in Peril, Scrutinizes Kennedy on Vaccines
summary: Senator Bill Cassidy, a Republican physician and vaccine proponent who is facing a primary challenge from the right, has a fraught relationship with the health secretary.

title: Surgeon General Nominee Pledges to Divest From Wellness Interests
summary: In financial filings, Casey Means stated that she would liquidate holdings in companies that sell personal devices, supplements, tobacco and tech.

title: California’s Environmental Past Confronts Economic Worries of the Present
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom and Democratic state lawmakers have focused on pocketbook concerns this year, seeing their party’s national losses as a reckoning.

title: California’s High Gas Prices Could Climb Further as Refineries Close
summary: The state has led the country in adopting electric cars and reducing gas use, but it now faces much higher gas prices as oil companies plan to shut down refineries.

title: ‘People Are Losing Hope’: Suicide Risk Is Rife in ICE Detention Centers
summary: Immigrant detainees are not receiving proper mental health care, lawyers and advocacy groups say, and reports of suicide attempts are persistent.

title: Whistle-Blower Account Contradicts Government’s Claims on Guatemalan Children
summary: A report filed to Congress on Tuesday alleges the Trump administration concealed data showing that dozens of children it sought to deport faced serious harm back in Guatemala.

title: Joe Manchin Would Like a Word. (OK, Maybe Several Words.)
summary: The voluble former senator, now retired from politics, appears to miss the arena and is mulling a return to it.

title: Our Allies Are Asking: ‘Why Does Putin Still Own Trump?’
summary: Ukrainian and European officials, analysts and entrepreneurs keep asking privately, “What’s up with Trump?”

title: Why the Kirk Assassination Is a Warning to the Left
summary: Progressives need a cure for political desperation and despair.

title: Prosecutors Seek Death Penalty in Killing of Charlie Kirk
summary: Also, Israeli troops pushed into Gaza City. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: Asylum Seeker Wins Bid to Delay Deportation Under U.K.-France Treaty
summary: The case was the first challenge relating to the treaty, which aims to reduce small-boat crossings of the English Channel by migrants, to reach London’s High Court.

title: Ex-Midshipman Is Charged in Threat That Led to 2 Injuries at U.S. Naval Academy
summary: The threat, which was made on social media, caused fears of an active shooter on the campus last week, leading to one person being shot and another injured.

title: Pat Crowley, Veteran Actress of Film and TV, Dies at 91
summary: Named the year’s “new star” at the 1954 Golden Globes, she appeared alongside the biggest names of her time. She later embarked on a long career in television.

title: Tropical System Could Bring Heavy Rain to Southern California This Week
summary: The remains of Tropical Storm Mario could bring flooding to the Los Angeles area. Dry storms with lightning could ignite wildfires in Northern California.
